sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
The honest whore with, the humours of the patient man, and the longing vvife. Tho: Dekker. Dekker, Thomas, ca. 1572-1632. Middleton, Thomas, d. 1627.
[80] p.
Printed by V[alentine] S[immes and others] for Iohn Hodgets, and are to be solde at his shop in Paules church-yard, London : 1604.
Written in collaboration with Thomas Middleton. Partly in verse. The first word of the title is xylographic. "Simmes app[arently]. pr[inted]. only quires A-B"--STC. Signatures: A-K⁴. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

[80] p.
Printed by V[alentine] S[immes and others] for Iohn Hodgets, and are to be solde at his shop in Paules church-yard, London : 1604.
Written in collaboration with Thomas Middleton. Partly in verse. The first word of the title is xylographic. "Simmes app[arently]. pr[inted]. only quires A-B"--STC. Signatures: A-K⁴. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
Iohn Hodgets
V[alentine] S[immes and others]
his shop in Paules church-yard
